messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Wasfia Nazreen first saw a **hula hoop**, which is a large plastic ring that people spin around their body for fun, when she was a young girl in her home country, Bangladesh. She saw a child from another country playing with it, and she watched, but she felt sad, because in her country, people thought that girls should not play with hula hoops or ride bikes. Now, Wasfia is one of the few people in the world who has climbed the Seven Summits, such as Everest and Kilimanjaro. She is also the first person to have used a hula hoop on the top of each of these mountains, and her reason for doing this was to help women and girls in her country feel strong and confident, because in Bangladesh, they are often told not to do sport.
